name: Dratini
flavorText: Long considered a mythical Pokémon until recently, when a small colony was found living underwater.

strengths: No weakness makes it harder to one-hit KO than other 40 HP Basics
Psychic resistance (-30) is valuable against Psychic-heavy meta
Only 1 retreat cost makes it easy to switch to safety
Pound costs only 1 energy, allowing immediate response if needed
Colorless typing allows it to fit in any deck type
Evolves into powerful Dragonair and Dragonite
Uncommon rarity makes it accessible for deck building
weaknesses: 40 HP is very low and vulnerable to most attackers
10 damage from Pound is largely ineffective
Requires two evolution stages to reach Dragonite
Cannot evolve until next turn after being played
Dragonair and Dragonite are rare, making evolution line difficult to complete
Vulnerable to Trainer disruption like Gust of Wind forcing it active
Limited attacking capability makes it a liability if stuck active
counters: Hitmonchan - Special Punch deals 40 damage for 1 Fighting energy, instant KO
Electabuzz - Thunderpunch can OHKO with good coin flips
Any aggressive Basic Pokémon with 40+ damage output
Gust of Wind - Forces Dratini active before it can evolve
Energy Removal - Prevents even the basic Pound attack
Professor Oak - Can discard evolution cards from opponent's hand

description: Dratini is the Basic Dragon-type Pokémon that serves as the foundation for one of the most powerful evolution lines in the Base Set. Despite its modest 40 HP and simple Pound attack, Dratini's true value lies in its potential to evolve into the formidable Dragonite. As a Colorless-type with Psychic resistance and no weakness, Dratini has unique defensive properties that help it survive long enough to reach its later evolutions.
competitiveHistory: Dratini saw limited competitive play due to the difficulty of completing the Dragonite evolution line. While Dragonite was powerful, the Stage 2 evolution requirement and the rarity of the cards made it impractical for most tournament decks. When Dratini did appear, it was almost always as a necessary component of Dragonite decks rather than for its own merits. The card was more popular in casual play where players could enjoy the Dragon evolution line regardless of competitive viability.

rulings.ruling: Without a weakness, Dratini never takes double damage from attacks, regardless of the attacking Pokémon's type.
When Dratini is damaged by an attack from a Psychic-type Pokémon, reduce that damage by 30 (after applying weakness and other effects).
Pokémon Breeder still requires that you cannot evolve a Pokémon on the turn it was played or on your first turn.
Colorless is a type - it just means that Dratini is not weak or resistant to its own type, and its attacks can be powered by any energy type.
